required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence of Commuting Accidents Among Non-physician Staff of a Large University Hospital Center From 2012 to 2016
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Commuting Accidents Among Non-physician Staff of a Large University Hospital Center From 2012 to 2016

brief_summary.textblock: Over the past thirty years, risk of road traffic accidents has decreased but remains high and accounts for 44% of fatal work-related accidents for commuting and mission-related accidents. The aims of this study were to estimate the overall incidence of commuting accidents for non-physician professionals in a major university hospital and by gender and different professional categories, and to assess its evolution over a 5-year period. A descriptive analysis was performed on 390 commuting accidents from 2012 to 2016 extracted from the university hospital's occupational health service.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of commuting accidents according to sex, occupational categories and year of accident. The evolution of the number of accidents over the years was assessed by the Cochran-Armitage ChiÂ² trend test. Crude Relative risk (RR) and 95% confidence intervals for the association of commuting accident with respectively sex, occupational categories and years were estimated on log-binomial regression using the using the GENMOD procedure in the SAS statistical package (version 9.4) with the DIST=BINOMIAL and LINK=LOG options.

arm_group.description: All non-physician staff who have had commuting accidents

intervention.description: informations about commuting accidents were recorded either during an occupational medicine consultation or by the medical service after reception of the medical certificate and the administrative declaration

study_pop.textblock: non-physician staff working at the Hospices Civils de Lyon and having had commuting accidents between 2012 and 2016

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-physician staff
- commuting accidents
Exclusion Criteria:
- work accidents
- on-duty road accidents
- physician staff
